message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

This paper is about semantic segmentation using convolutional neural networks, which is a popular topic in computer vision (cs.CV). The paper proposes a new method for multi-scale feature learning, which involves adapting the dilation rate for each pixel in the image. This is a novel approach to solving the problem of fixed dilation rates in dilated convolution, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning (cs.LG). The paper also involves end-to-end training of the network, which is a common theme in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The proposed method involves learning an appropriate dilation rate for each pixel, which is a form of neural architecture search, a topic in neural engineering (cs.NE). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method on medical images, which is a common application area for computer vision and machine learning (cs.MM).
